subject: @Test improvement

messageBody:
In the @Test annotation there is expected() parameters that is used to
indicate expected exception. It should be considered to enable check
also the cause of the exception.

For example, InvocationTargetException with nested exception is
thrown. I have currently catch of InvocationTargetException and
afterwards I check whether InvocationTargetException.getCause() is
instanceof expected exception.

One more example is javax.ejb.EJBException which getCause() mechanism,
at least at JBoss and Glassfish implimentation, is not working and
getCausedByException() should be called instead, so it should be a way
to say it in @Test annotation.

It can be considered to check only the cause, but the cause of the
cause and so forth. It can be useful in some (rare) cases and
implementation is not difficult.
